remarks: Form of ~ wlogle where both sides of the equivalence are proven rather than showing that they are equivalent to each other.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2015.)
statement:
wlogle.1 $e |- ( ( z = x /\ w = y ) -> ( ps <-> ch ) ) $.
wlogle.2 $e |- ( ( z = y /\ w = x ) -> ( ps <-> th ) ) $.
wlogle.3 $e |- ( ph -> S C_ RR ) $.
wloglei.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ x <_ y ) ) -> th ) $.
wloglei.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ x <_ y ) ) -> ch ) $.
wloglei $p |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ch ) $.
$d S w x y z $.
$d ch w z $.
$d ph w x y z $.
$d ps x y $.
